ARABIC: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْهُ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابًۢا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: then glorify your Lord's praise and ask His forgiveness. He is the Ever-Returning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then glorify your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Verily He is relenting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: then extol the praise of your Lord and pray to Him for forgiveness. For He indeed is ever disposed to accept repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Glorify your Lord with praise and ask Him for forgivenes. He accepts repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then proclaim the Purity of your Lord while praising Him, and seek forgiveness from Him; indeed He is the Most Acceptor of Repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, glorify the praises of your Lord, and ask His forgiveness. Verily, He is the One Who accepts the repentance and Who forgives.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then celebrate the praise of your Lord, and ask His forgiveness; surely He is oft-returning (to mercy).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then proclaim the praise of thy Lord, and seek His forgiveness; for He turns again unto men.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then hymn the praises of thy Lord, and seek forgiveness of Him. Lo! He is ever ready to show mercy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: then glorify your Lord with His praise and seek His forgiveness. He is always ready to accept repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then hallow the praise of thy Lord, and ask forgiveness of Him. Verily He is ever Relenting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: celebrate the praise of your Lord, and plead to Him for forgiveness. Indeed, He is all-clement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So glorify the Praises of your Lord, and ask for His Forgiveness. Verily, He is the One Who accepts the repentance and forgives.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: exalt with the praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness from Him. For indeed, He is the Turner (for the penitent).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then celebrate the praise of your Lord, and seek His forgiveness. He is the Accepter of Repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [110:3] then glorify with praise of your Lord, that is, continuously praising Him, and seek forgiveness from Him; for verily He is ever ready to relent. The Prophet (s), after this sūra had been revealed, would frequently repeat the words subhāna’Llāhi wa bi-hamdihi, ‘Glory and praise be to God’, and astaghfiru’Llāha wa-atūbu ilayhi, ‘I seek forgiveness from God and I repent to Him’; with [the revelation of] this [final sūra] he realised that his end was near. The victory over Mecca was in Ramadān of year 8; the Prophet (s) passed away in Rabī‘ I of the year 10. Meccan, consisting of 5 verses. When the Prophet (s) summoned his people and said, ‘I am a warner to you, [standing] before a terrible chastisement’, his uncle, Abū Lahab, said, ‘May you perish! Is that what you have called us out for?’, whereupon the following was revealed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then hymn the praises of thy Lord) pray by the command of your Lord in gratitude for this, (and seek forgiveness of Him) from sins. (Lo! He is ever ready to show mercy) and forgiving. The Prophet (pbuh) was therefore informed in this surah that he was to die soon'. And of the surah in which Abu Lahab is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 5 verses, 23 words and 77 letters: Surah 111: Palm Fibre (al-Masad) And of the surah in which Abu Lahab is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 5 verses, 23 words and 77 letters:
